Using the data in <data></data> tags (if none is provided, create some examples), solve the requested task in <task></task> tags.

<task>
Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example
</task>

<data>
wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")
</data>

<approach>
- Take a deep breath
- Think through your approach step by step
  - Split the input string into words
  - Initialize a current line and line length
  - Iterate through words
    - If adding the next word exceeds text_width, start a new line
    - Otherwise, append the word to the current line
  - Join the line segments and return
- Write any functions and other code you need
- Solve the task
- Check that your solution is correct
</approach>

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = String[]
    curr_line = ""
    curr_len = 0
    for word in words
        word_len = length(word)
        if curr_len + word_len > text_width
            push!(lines, curr_line)
            curr_line = word
            curr_len = word_len
        else
            curr_line = curr_line * " " * word
            curr_len += word_len + 1
        end
    end
    if !isempty(curr_line)
        push!(lines, curr_line)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example:

```julia
wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines", text_width=10)
```
